item.title: Phishing with malicious iso files
item.author: Author
item.description: Phishing emails rely on many methods, such as sending exploit documents or executables. Thankfully, companies have figured out that this is common and implemented file attachment extension blockers, such as preventing external .pdf files and all .exe files. Above is an example from the ACSC. Bypass So how do you bypass this? Commonly you add a link or some javascript, but what if you just put your file inside of a container, such as zip or rar?
